Package algorithms

Class TwoCoreIntBased

java.lang.Object
algorithms.TwoCoreIntBased
public class TwoCoreIntBased extends Object
Computes the vertices and edges in the two core of a graph, WITHOUT constructing a new graph. Process: recognize edges incident to degree one vertices, and update vertex degrees. Modified from trubbl-core project so vertices and edges are both of Integer type. This allows passing results back in the form of boolean arrays.

Applicable to SparseIntDirectedWeightedGraph and SparseIntUnirectedWeightedGraph objects. Example

Edge list of random graph: {h, b}, {e, b}, {g, h}, {g, d}, {d, f}, {a, k}, {g, e}, {b, k}, {a, g}, Two core vertices: a, b, e, g, h, k, Two core edges: {h, b}, {b, k}, {a, k}, {g, h}, {g, e}, {e, b}, {a, g}, Numbers of edges removed per round: 1, 1, 0.

Author:
R. W. R. Darling
